ai-ud5.6:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud5.6:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Mahākaccāna was staying in the land of the Avantis near Kuraraghara on Steep Mountain.
ai-ud5.6:1.4_0: And the layman Soṇa of the pointy ears was Mahākaccānas attendant.
ai-ud5.6:2.1_0: Then as Soṇa was in private retreat this thought came to his mind,
ai-ud5.6:2.2_0: “As I understand Venerable Mahākaccāna’s teachings, it’s not easy for someone living at home to lead the spiritual life utterly full and pure, like a polished shell.
ai-ud5.6:2.3_0: Why don’t I cut off my hair and beard, dress in ocher robes, and go forth from lay life to homelessness?”
ai-ud5.6:3.1_0: Then Soṇa went up to Mahākaccāna, and told him what he was thinking. Then he said,
ai-ud5.6:4.1_0: “Just now, sir, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind.
ai-ud5.6:4.2_0: ‘As I understand Venerable Mahākaccāna’s teachings, it’s not easy for someone living at home to lead the spiritual life utterly full and pure, like a polished shell.
ai-ud5.6:4.3_0: Why don’t I cut off my hair and beard, dress in ocher robes, and go forth from lay life to homelessness?’
ai-ud5.6:4.4_0: “May Venerable Mahākaccāna please give me the going forth!”
ai-ud5.6:5.1_0: When this was said, Mahākaccāna said to him,
ai-ud5.6:5.2_0: “It’s hard to lead the spiritual life as long as you live, eating in one part of the day and sleeping alone.
ai-ud5.6:5.3_0: So follow the instruction of the Buddhas while remaining as a householder, and at suitable times you may eat one meal a day, sleep by yourself, and practice celibacy.”

ai-ud5.6:12.1_0: “Just now, sir, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind.
ai-ud5.6:12.2_0: ‘I’ve seen and heard this in my presence.’
ai-ud5.6:12.4_0: “If my preceptor allows me, I’ll go and visit that Buddha.”
ai-ud5.6:13.2_0: Please go and visit the Buddha, the perfected and fully awakened one.
ai-ud5.6:13.3_0: You will see him—pleasing to the eye and inspiring confidence; peaceful in mind and faculties; attained to the supreme subduing and calm; tamed, guarded, and restrained in his sense faculties; a great being.
ai-ud5.6:13.4_0: Seeing this, one is healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
ai-ud5.6:13.5_0: Venerable Sir, my preceptor, Venerable Mahākaccāna, pays respect with his head at the Buddha’s feet. He asks if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.’”
ai-ud5.6:14.1_0: Saying “Yes, sir,” Soṇa approved and agreed with what Mahākaccāna said. He got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled Mahākaccāna, keeping him on his right. Then he set his lodgings in order and, taking his bowl and robe, set out for Sāvatthī.
ai-ud5.6:14.2_0: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha, sat down,
ai-ud5.6:14.4_0: “Sir, my preceptor, Venerable Mahākaccāna, pays respect with his head at the Buddha’s feet. He asks if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.”
ai-ud5.6:15.1_0: “I hope you’re keeping well, mendicant; I hope you’re traveling. And I hope you’re having no trouble getting alms-food.”
ai-ud5.6:15.2_0: “I’m keeping well, sir; I’m not alright. And I’m having no trouble getting alms-food.”
ai-ud5.6:16.2_0: “Ānanda, please prepare a resting place for this newly arrived monk.”
ai-ud5.6:16.4_0: “When the Buddha tells me to come,
ai-ud5.6:16.5_0: it means to stay in the same dwelling as Venerable Soṇa.”

ai-ud5.6:19.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud5.6:20.1_0: “Having seen the danger in the world,
ai-ud5.6:20.3_0: The noble one doesn’t delight in what’s bad;
ai-ud5.6:20.4_0: In the bad, the pure one doesn’t delight.”
